post.description: The EST interface receives CSRs from CPOs, eMSPs, OEMs, and CPSs, signs them, and delivers an ISO 15118 leaf certificate. The PKI Gateway/Certificate Manager creates the leaf certificates from the Sub 2 CA of the respective role. This interface can create leaf certificates for CPOs (SECC Certificate), eMSPs (Contract Certificate), OEMs (Provisioning Certificate), and CPSs (Provisioning Signing Certificates). An EST interface is a standard implementation described in RFC7030.

parameters.name: caDomain
parameters.description: The domain of the subCA the certificate is requested from.

parameters.name: iso15118Version
parameters.description: The ISO version which shall be used. If not set, ISO15118:2 will be used as default.

parameters.name: algorithm
parameters.description: Defines the algorithm for the PKI which shall be used.

requestBody.description:
The body is the base64 encoded CSR (Certificate Siging Request).

+++Requirements for EVSE Leafs+++

When `{ca}` path parameter is `cpo`, the CSR CommonName must match to the <EVSID> regex format `^[A-Za-z]{2}[\*]?\w{3}[\*]?[E][\w\*]{1,30}$`. 

Where `EVSEID` = `<Country Code>` `<S>` `<EVSE Operator ID>` `<S>` `<ID Type>` `<Power Outlet ID>` 

 `Country Code` = 2 ALPHA two alphanumeric characters 

 `EVSE Operator ID` = 3 (ALPHA / DIGIT) three alphanumeric characters, defined and listed by eMI3 group 

 `ID Type` = “E” one character “E” indicating that this ID represents an “EVSE” 

 `Power Outlet ID` = (ALPHA / DIGIT) *30 (ALPHA / DIGIT / S) sequence of alphanumeric characters or separators 

 `S` = optional separator 

 Reference: ISO 15118-2:2014, Annex H, H.2.1 EVSEID Syntax

schema.description: The response body is the base64 encoded PKCS7 blobb of the certificate
